text:
2. Keep the calculator in the annual compounding mode (P/Y = 1) and enter I/Y as
the interest rate per compounding period, and N as the number of compounding
periods in the investment horizon. Letting m equal the number of compounding
periods per year, the basic formulas for the calculator input data are determined as
follows:
I/Y = the annual interest rate / m
N = the number of years x m
